truth: -  "Electromagnetic waves can travel through a vacuum."
fiction: -  "Electromagnetic waves require a physical medium to travel."

truth: -  "The electromagnetic force is one of the four fundamental forces of nature."
fiction: -  "The electromagnetic force is a minor, insignificant force in nature."

truth: -  "Electromagnetism is responsible for the interaction between charged particles."
fiction: -  "Electromagnetism is responsible for the interaction between neutral particles."

truth: -  "Light is an example of an electromagnetic wave."
fiction: -  "Sound is an example of an electromagnetic wave."

truth: -  "Electromagnetic fields are produced by electrically charged objects."
fiction: -  "Electromagnetic fields are produced by objects with no charge."

truth: -  "The speed of electromagnetic waves in a vacuum is approximately 299,792 kilometers per second."
fiction: -  "The speed of electromagnetic waves in a vacuum is approximately 60 kilometers per hour."

truth: -  "Electromagnetic waves include radio waves, microwaves, infrared, visible light, ultraviolet, X-rays, and gamma rays."
fiction: -  "Electromagnetic waves include sound waves, seismic waves, and ocean waves."

truth: -  "Maxwell's equations describe how electric and magnetic fields interact."
fiction: -  "Maxwell's equations describe how gravity and magnetic fields interact."

truth: -  "Electromagnetic waves are transverse waves, which means the direction of the wave is perpendicular to the direction of the oscillation."
fiction: -  "Electromagnetic waves are longitudinal waves, which means the direction of the wave is the same as the direction of the oscillation."

truth: -  "The electromagnetic spectrum is the range of all possible frequencies of electromagnetic radiation."
fiction: -  "The electromagnetic spectrum is the range of all possible colors visible to the human eye."

truth: -  "The force of electromagnetism is carried by a particle called a photon."
fiction: -  "The force of electromagnetism is carried by a particle called a neutron."

truth: -  "The strength of the electromagnetic force decreases with the square of the distance between the charges."
fiction: -  "The strength of the electromagnetic force increases with the square of the distance between the charges."

truth: -  "Electromagnetic waves can be polarized, which means the direction of their oscillation can be controlled."
fiction: -  "Electromagnetic waves cannot be polarized, their direction of oscillation is always random."

truth: -  "The phenomenon of electromagnetic induction allows the generation of electricity in a coil of wire by changing the magnetic field within the coil."
fiction: -  "The phenomenon of electromagnetic induction allows the generation of gravity in a coil of wire by changing the magnetic field within the coil."

truth: -  "The electromagnetic force is much stronger than the gravitational force."
fiction: -  "The electromagnetic force is much weaker than the gravitational force."

truth: -  "The electromagnetic force can both attract and repel."
fiction: -  "The electromagnetic force can only attract."

truth: -  "The electromagnetic force acts between charged particles."
fiction: -  "The electromagnetic force acts between uncharged particles."

truth: -  "The electromagnetic force is responsible for holding electrons in their orbits around the nucleus."
fiction: -  "The electromagnetic force is responsible for pushing electrons away from the nucleus."

truth: -  "Electromagnetic waves are produced by accelerating electric charges."
fiction: -  "Electromagnetic waves are produced by stationary electric charges."

truth: -  "The electromagnetic force is responsible for most of the interactions we see in our daily life, such as friction, elasticity, and chemical reactions."
fiction: -  "The electromagnetic force is responsible for none of the interactions we see in our daily life, such as friction, elasticity, and chemical reactions."

truth: -  "The electromagnetic force is both long-ranged and infinite, unlike the strong and weak nuclear forces."
fiction: -  "The electromagnetic force is short-ranged and finite, unlike the strong and weak nuclear forces."

truth: -  "The direction of the electromagnetic force on a positive charge is always along the direction of the field."
fiction: -  "The direction of the electromagnetic force on a positive charge is always opposite to the direction of the field."

truth: -  "The electromagnetic force can be shielded or blocked to some extent by certain materials."
fiction: -  "The electromagnetic force cannot be shielded or blocked by any material."

truth: -  "The electromagnetic force is responsible for the chemical properties of atoms."
fiction: -  "The electromagnetic force is responsible for the nuclear properties of atoms."
